subject: Add option to build the Wi-Fi Display feature
commitMessage:
Add option to build the Wi-Fi Display feature

The option "CONFIG_WIFI_DISPLAY" is required to enable the Miracast
feature.
Also add the "CONFIG_READLINE" option to get a command history in
wpa_cli.

Update changelog.

Bug-Tizen: TIVI-2522
Change-Id: I51289d66285d2a4c022e439d5004f9d61d0e03cc
Signed-off-by: Kévin THIERRY <kevin.thierry@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Add config file wpa_supplicant-p2p.conf
commitMessage:
Add config file wpa_supplicant-p2p.conf

This config file is required for advanced Wi-Fi features such as
Wi-Fi Direct. Parameters required for Wi-Fi Direct are added to the
config file.

Also set a valid group tag in spec file.

Update changelog.

Change-Id: Id94c6c5c9383d9e7c926a0b25a3d0215c23e0129
Bug-Tizen: TIVI-2511
Signed-off-by: Kévin THIERRY <kevin.thierry@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

Maybe it would be better to rename it something like: wpa_supplicant-p2p.conf in case there are other modes/configurations used. Also I put it under /etc/ but it might be better to put it under /etc/wpa_supplicant/ especially if there are several configuration files.

Any thoughts about that ?

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I cant +2 this

Patch Set 1:

I think if you want to make the config file only for wifi P2P feature settings, it's better to rename it to wpa_supplicant-p2p.conf, if you just want the config file to include wifi P2P feature settings, current implementation is OK, so what's your preferrence?

Patch Set 1:

I'll rename it wpa_supplicant-p2p.conf and put it under /etc/wpa_supplicant/.
Uploaded patch set 2.
Uploaded patch set 3.
Patch Set 3: Verified+1
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1
Uploaded patch set 4.
Patch Set 4: Verified+1
Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 4:

Zhengguang  Since you +1 this, can you +2 it?  Looks like you are the one true maintainer for this package
Patch Set 4: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:Mobile: 

 repository     arch           result         

 qemu           x86_64         succeeded      

 qemu           armv7l         succeeded      

 qemu           i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Because this is a samsung platform specific issue, I think the best way is to make it configurable in spec file, we can check the ARCH in spec file and only when it is ARM platform, we enable the macro, by this way, we don't need modify spec file when build IA image.

Besides, It's better to define the Macro name not to be TIZEN_EXT, maybe TIZEN_ARM is more reasonable, you know that in ConnMan, we add CFLAGS+=" -DTIZEN_EXT", and the related code is used for both ARM and IA platform in ConnMan, if here we define the Macro name to be TIZEN_EXT, too, it will be a little confusing to others.

subject: Tethering: Cancel delayed scheduled scan when wpa_supplicant cleans up
commitMessage: Tethering: Cancel delayed scheduled scan when wpa_supplicant cleans up

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

The delay sched scan is not cancel when wpa_supplicant clean up, which maybe result in crash because delay sched scan will access the member of struct wpa_supplicant and which is freed.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

Zhengguang/Chenyi:
Please submit the patch to WPA_s upstream.
According to the Tizen Comms working rule.
All the upstream patches should be submitted to upstream firstly.
Because it is old Tizen-2.1 patches, I will just accept it. Please submitted all these kind of patches to upstream.

So as to the new patches, I will not accept before sent to upstream.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
